lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Museum of Art’s MediaLab has installed a projector to show what this temple may have looked like in its original, polychromatic form.

headline.print_headline: Temple of Dendur’s Lost Colors Brought to Life
headline.main: Temple of Dendur’s Lost Colors Brought to Life at the Met

snippet: The Metropolitan Museum of Art’s MediaLab has installed a projector to show what this temple may have looked like in its original, polychromatic form.
abstract: Metropolitan Museum of Art's exhibit Color the Temple: Scene 1 features digital depiction of ancient Egyptian Temple of Dendur in its original state, filling in engravings of washed-out section with color; technique, developed by Met’s MediaLab, used 1906 survey and illustrations from Napoleon-era documents to figure out hues; museum plans to expand capability to other parts of shrine.
